Live from NPR News in Culver City California I'm Janine hurts the cleanup from hurricane Michael continues across several state so at least fourteen people have died for rescuers haven't reached some of the hardest hit areas yet NPR's Quil Lawrence is in Mexico Beach Florida

Hundreds of thousands are without power authorities say that could last for weeks
President Trump says he plans to ... over the next twenty four hours to discuss the disappearance unlikely death of Washington Post journalist ... he was last seen an episode of conflict and assemble and as NPR's Tamara Keith reports that's complicating the U.S Saudi relationship
Talking to reporters at the White House President Trump acknowledged that it doesn't look good for the show ... who disappeared nearly two weeks ago Trump says his administration is still gathering information and that's why he hasn't yet called the Saudi king to discuss it
We don't know nobody knows right now the answer we're looking for the

Aspect that punishment should be Trump said there are many options but he doesn't want to stop sales of military equipment to the kingdom camera Keith NPR News
This book has released more details on a recent security breach that exposed a personal details of millions of users and various ... reports
In the last two weeks of September attackers exploited three bugs and Facebook's code to gain access to users account they didn't get any passwords but they didn't have to they were able to act just like they were logged in
Facebook now says thirty million people had their accounts access about half had their name and email or phone number taken but for fourteen million the attackers viewed more including their gender religion birthday recent location check ins and search history [noise]
Four hundred thousand people had their post their groups and listen to friends access to Facebook wouldn't discuss who carried out the attack or why citing an active FBI investigation ... NPR News
And the company has set up a website so people can check and see if their account was attacked and this is NPR News
The slain controversial archbishop ... will become a saint tomorrow Pope Francis canonized seven figures of the Catholic Church as NPR's Carrie Kahn reports mountains of Salvadorans have traveled to Rome for the ceremony including the man who says the archbishop performed a miracle and saved his wife's life
I had to read that says if it wasn't for archbishop Oscar Romero his wife would have died three years ago she fell into a coma while pregnant with their third child doctors told reverse at the time to pray for a miracle
... what are the lower than that you just tell us your ... or ... percent of
The same hour I prayed to Romero was the same hour she started to recuperate says reversing a call from Rome revisit his wife made a full recovery and he and their three children are all attending the cannon is Asian as guests of the church
Romero was murdered while giving mass in San Salvador Nineteen eighty he was an outspoken critic of the repression by the country's us backed army and defender of the poor Francis diverse Latin American pope personally push through Romero sainthood Carrie Kahn NPR News
President Trump campaigning in Richmond, Kentucky tonight for Republican candidates in that state the crowd that every voter faces a choice once again saying the Democrats are the party of crime all the Republicans are the party of safety
Troubles campaigning for three term congressman Andy Barr who's fighting off a strong challenge from Democrat Amy graph a retired Marine fighter pilot it's the latest campaign rally trough it's held around the country ahead of the mid term elections that happen next month
I'm Janine hurts and you're listening to NPR News from Culver City California
